channel.title: Setting up arch
channel.description:
Alright, well my brother is fucking retarded and ran a blatant virus given to him from his "clan leader" on runescape and wanted me to put arch linux on his computer... and I was like "sure why not, I just finished installing it on my laptop and got it fully functional, and you can play runescape and that's all you do anyway..."
so i put the disk in, install from the internet so it's already up to date... I get all that done, get alsa working fine and everything; Then comes Xorg...
I installed the nvidia driver I need (nvidia-96xx) and then I tried both Xorg -configure and nvidia-xconfig...
Here's the current xorg.conf: http://codepad.org/NUj4F7sO Here's the Xorg.0.log: http://codepad.org/HOaD8v6z here's my dmesg: http://codepad.org/YznOXlck here's lspci: http://codepad.org/dIXJbZrD
Even trying the minimal configuration: http://codepad.org/kHjIXaFC
Even tried nouveau: http://codepad.org/kHjIXaFC Evidently I don't have any screens?
Oh, and I tried to take the pussy's way out and install ubuntu but it doesn't even load up into a GUI it loads up into a terminal and in the error log it's complaining about not finding a screen.

item.title: Setting up arch
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Moparisthebest:

Basically what I meant by my above post was that if I can install KDE and pacman not install some type of x server, then it’s forseeable that you tell pacman to install Xorg and it not install something it actually requires to run.

Ahh, I see what you mean. That is an issue specific to Xorg, since the release of the modular Xorg the metapackage doesn’t install an input driver or video driver. This allows people to choose between configless xorg by installing dbus & evdev (and have hotswapping) or do it the old way if they don’t want to run dbus for some reason.

Personally I’m not really a fan of that approach, I assume anyone who is that devoted to not running dbus would just not use the meta-package.

Read full topic

item.title: Setting up arch
item.dc:creator: @Evil1 Evil_
item.description:
@Evil1 wrote:

Turns out mom and dad are going to send out his computer lol; Less work for me

item.title: Setting up arch
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Mopman:

Hm? Pacman does dependency resolution

If you remember the thread I posted about arch awhile back you know what I mean:

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

Basically what I meant by my above post was that if I can install KDE and pacman not install some type of x server, then it’s forseeable that you tell pacman to install Xorg and it not install something it actually requires to run.

Read full topic

Hm? Pacman does dependency resolution

Where did you get the nvidia drivers from?

item.title: Setting up arch
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I’d be concerned about this:

[ 1140.324] (WW) NVIDIA: This server has an unsupported input driver ABI version (have 9.0, need < 8.0). The driver will continue to load, but may behave strangely.

I’d try a newer Nvidia driver, or an older X server.

Or it may be something Arch specific that you didn’t install, since it doesn’t install every dependency that you need when you request a package. I may be able to help you out more if you posted your ubuntu or debian logs.

Read full topic
